citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, the IACUC was not preparing reports of the semiannual reviews and submitting them to the
Institutional Official (IO). Not alerting the IO on results of semiannual evaluations of the facility can result in detriments
and delays in the care and welfare of animals. The IACUC must prepare reports of its evaluations and submit them to the
IO of the research facility. The reports shall be reviewed and signed by a majority of the IACUC members and must
include any minority views.
Correct by 26 May 2023 by preparing a report of the last semiannual review, have a majority of IACUC members sign the
report and submit to the IO. All future semiannual review reports must also follow this standard.

The Annual Report for FY 2022 reported multiple species of animals exempt from research reporting such as dogs and
cats owned by clients, shelters or rescues receiving medically necessary procedures in the course of teaching veterinary
technician students. Correct reporting of all required information on the annual report is required so that the public, USDA
APHIS Animal Care, and Congress can have knowledge of the number, type, and pain category of animals used- or held
for use in research.
Correct by 7 June 2023 by submitting an amended Annual Report for FY 2022 with correct number of regulated animals
to USDA APHIS Animal Care.

A developed contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to
provide humane handling of animals during emergent events. The registrant must develop a complete contingency plan
tailored to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this
plan and the facility must maintain documentation thereof. The plan must also be reviewed annually, and any changes
documented and maintained.
Correct by 26 May 2023 by developing a contingency plan and training employees.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.

Correct by 7 June 2023 by submitting an amended Annual Report for FY 2022 with correct number of regulated animals

2.38(l)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous.
